thread.title: John Goodman debuts slim physique at 'Trumbo' screening - UPI.com
thread.title_full: John Goodman debuts slim physique at 'Trumbo' screening - UPI.com

author: upi.com
title: John Goodman debuts slim physique at 'Trumbo' screening - UPI.com
text:
1 of 3 | License Photo LONDON, Oct. 9 (UPI) -- Looks like someone's been hitting the gym.
John Goodman looked almost unrecognizable at the London screening of Trumbo , a biographical drama starring himself, Helen Mirren and Bryan Cranston .
This is not the first time the Goodman has been public about his weight loss struggles saying that his heaviest was 400 pounds.
Back in 2010, the Roseanne star lost over 100 pounds.
At the time, he told People magazine that he "wanted to live life better." The actor quit drinking and worked out six days a week.
This time around, the Golden Globe winner says he is not doing anything out of the ordinary.
His rep told ABC News that Goodman is sticking to basic exercise and diet routines.
Though the actor is embracing his new physique, he says his weight loss journey is far from over.
"I'd get off of Roseanne every spring. I'd lose 60 pounds every spring," he said to David Letterman in 2010. "Then I got too fond of the barleycorn. I'd gain it back and then some, every year. It's going to be an ongoing process for the rest of my life."
